website_summaries.verdict: A great choice if you want Osprey quality at a fraction of the cost.
pros: No frills, lightweight day pack (weights only 3.2 ounces) that fits lots of essential items at a super affordable price
cons: Customers commented that the grey and black color options are misleading

customer_reviews.title: nice lightweight pack
customer_reviews.text: bought this for a trip to disneyworld....not heavy, just enough volume to hold five disposable rain ponchos and a real rain jacket, plus four water bottles (the side mesh pocket will also hold two 16 oz. water bottles). made it through the trip in one piece (the pack, not so much me)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! I bought it for a trip recently. Not only was it great for short hikes, but it was also nice to have as a spill over piece of luggage for random souvenir purchases. Few features worth noting: (1) the zippers are really quality; (2) the extra top zip-pouch is extremely convenient for stashing phone, boarding pass, wallet, etc. It even has a mini-pouch within the pouch, and a clip for keys! (3) Finally, the rolled up size is crazy-small! I included a pic next to an iPhone 7 (NOT plus) so you can see. I almost bought the Sea to Summit one, but I’m glad I went with Osprey.
customer_reviews.author: kidrobotGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great little pack with one fixable flaw
customer_reviews.text: Love this pack but for one annoying flaw ... no matter how much weight you have in the pack, the shoulder straps will not stay on your shoulders. It needs a sternum strap (worth noting that all super-lightweight packable packs like this suffer from this design flaw). I purchased this removable sternum strap to fix this issue and it works perfectly —
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Burton

customer_reviews.title: Great design but transparent material
customer_reviews.text: Looking to use this as a daypack in Europe for a two week trip. I bought this backpack because on EasyJet you cannot bring a personal item in addition to a carryon bag, so whatever daypack I bring has to fit inside my carryon backpack. With that said, this is ideal for that situation because it weighs about an ounce and folds up into a small pouch that is actually an interior pocket in the bag. Cons, the material is very transparent and you can see exactly what is inside the bag when you are looking at it.
customer_reviews.author: bookgurl27

customer_reviews.title: Awesome day bag for exploring.
customer_reviews.text: An absolutely awesome travel pack. Did a week across Italy out of a single suitcase and used this during the day for items collected or brought with me for the day. Packs extremely small, fits jackets, towels, cameras and everything needed for a day out. The little packable pouch serves as a 3rd closeable pocket inside the 2nd pocket. Good for feeling a little more secure in areas you're worried about sneaky pick pockets. Only small downside is the thin shoulder straps. I have two messed up collar bones so it was even more uncomfortable but a full day of carrying it around full of camera gear and souvenirs really cuts into the shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: W. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight packable backpack!!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this great backpack for an 8 day cruise through the Southern Caribbean, and it performed great!! I constantly stuffed it full of items for shore excursions, and had zero issue with quality. The side elastic bottle holder easily accommodated 2 17oz S’well bottles. NOTE ON COLOR... the only reason I gave this 4 stars instead of 5, is the unexpected color. The description, and the tag on the bag, state Shadow Gray... this bag is in no way gray, unless by gray they mean GREEN. It is VERY green, with no hint of gray. It is still a good looking bag, but I would have preferred it to be gray.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great portable backpack.
customer_reviews.text: It looks like black but it's actually green. Not my most favorite color but it's acceptable. I don't understand why they don't make it black. Everybody loves black. It doesn't pack as compact as my Sea to Summit nano backpack but it's much more durable and have water bottle pocket on the outside which I consider most important. It's packed size is about my fist, so still acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Lee

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly light and packable travel bag
customer_reviews.text: This little bag is a lifesaver for traveling. It’s easy to fold into the integrated stuff sack, and when you need that extra storage, it’s right there. The zips are good; the water bottle side pocket is fine as long as you’re not doing cartwheels with the back your water bottle should stay secure...and this things is sooooo light. I would suggest not over-filling it, though. The straps are comfortable with moderate weight in the bag, but this thing isn’t meant to haul around your university books.
customer_reviews.author: J. Crabtree

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight day pack
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I used this as our daily bag while backpacking through Europe on days when we could leave our main packs in the hotel and we were walking and touring around. Fits a lot more stuff than you’d expect. I also used it as my carryon for the return trip and was able to really stuff it with everything that didn’t fit in my main bag. It also rolls up very small for days you don’t need it.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Marie

customer_reviews.title: Love this little pack
customer_reviews.text: I used this as for short day hikes during a 10-day backpack trip. I loved having the external pocket for my water bottle and it fit my Nalgene perfectly. I was worried that the side water bottle pocket would make the pack sit unevenly on my shoulders but this was not the case at all. It was lightweight and very comfortable. I carried rain gear, an extra warm layer, lunch, water... plenty of space and then some.
customer_reviews.author: V. Kelton

customer_reviews.title: Eh...just OK
customer_reviews.text: I needed a super-packable backpack for an upcoming trip. I ordered this bag and several others from different companies. While this bag wasn't bad, I MUCH preferred the one from Eagle Creek, even though it is smaller. This bag basically has one big cavity and a small pocket at the top. The bag is paper thin...I mean PAPER THIN. While it might hold up if you put light weight stuff in it, I don't trust it for a long trip with hard trekking. This one went back. Another note here...the turquoise bag is not at all the same color as is shown on the site. It's much duller in person.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Great...but room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pack. It packs into it's own small pouch to throw into your luggage and use whenever you're traveling. It's light, it takes up little room, the straps are more comfortable than some other travel packs, and it holds a lot of stuff. The thing I don't understand is why didn't Osprey put an identical water bottle holder on the opposite side from the existing one. Sure, it would add just a little bit of more weight and bulk, but it would be small. But the benefits of this additional water bottle holder would be to balance out the pack, and it's useful for other items like an umbrella, keys, etc. Great pack otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: I also received a dark olive color instead of gray
customer_reviews.text: I own an Osprey Farpoint 40-L bag in dark gray. My intention was to get a matching stuff pack. As several other commenters have mentioned, I received a pack that was actually a dark olive. I don't know if they're mixed up in the warehouse, or if some of the folks who think they've gotten "dark gray" actually got the olive and can't tell. (I'm a professional designer and I notice subtle colors.)
customer_reviews.author: El B

customer_reviews.title: Super compact, durable, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Recently used this on a cruise, with many shore excursions. It was to keep everyone’s phones and sunscreen somewhat safely contained. The little top pocket is a very nice feature, perfect for sunglasses or a phone. And the water bottle pocket is a great size. Straps are more comfortable and adjustable than a string bag. Basically there’s zero padding and the fabric is a bit translucent, so I made sure not to drop it. But for a light gear corral, it’s perfect. Thinking I’ll use it at Disneyworld later this month for hat/poncho/umbrella/water.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly light.
customer_reviews.text: My use for this is getting water or trips in town.Say hiking on the AT,5-25 mile day and you get to camp and set up.Next you need water.Some which will be a mile from camp,but no way you want to put your pack back on to go get water.After having carried 2 or 3 liter bags by hand up hills back to camp I chose to add this to my gear.It is worth the weight to me( all 4.6 ounces of it).Plus if staying in town i have a bag with me for store runs ect.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Seriously Ultralight, Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I guess I didn't take the word "ultralight" seriously, because I was really impressed with how lightweight this pack was. It seems very well made, and great for travel. I agree with another reviewer that the shadow grey has a greenish color (dark green or forest green), but that still works for me. Great product by Osprey!
customer_reviews.author: Fred Goodsell

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for what it is supposed to be.
customer_reviews.text: Its a great bag for what it was designed for. That is, this bag is super portable. There is literally no structure on this bag so when you put it on empty (or even when there is only a few thing in the bag), it "crunches up"/"curls up" and does not sit flat on your back. Also, there is minimal organization/compartments, but it works great as a day bag or stuff bag when I am traveling. The bag material itself should definitely last (within reason), no concerns there. Again, this bag is designed to be super portable, if you need something with more structure, support, or organization then look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Something

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed 'real' petite backpack- will get your wine home in good shape!
customer_reviews.text: These are neat little packs that squish up tiny in a pocket or suitcase corner for travel.. They are a real, well-constructed lightweight backpack, strong enough to hold (we tested this) several bottles of wine and a goodly assortment of cheese and bread... in other words, a modern picnic basket! A good value for a 'real' pack and ideal for travel or stashing in the car. Just to mine to Ireland/Scotland and used it almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: Somebody's Mother

customer_reviews.title: The best ultralight packable daypack
customer_reviews.text: This is the ultimate ultralight packable daypack on the market. I always stuff this in my larger travel packs (Porter 46 or Radial 34) when I travel oversea and use it as a secondary daypack. It weights less than 4 oz and has a functional water bottle pocket which holds my nalgene. The straps are padded and comfortable to carry even when packed fully. It is made of rip-stop 40D nylon and packs itself into its own little pocket. It is very thin, so you may feel the content if you happened to carry something with edge.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. E

customer_reviews.title: Better than the sea to summit ultra-sil daypack.
customer_reviews.text: If your trying to decide between the sea to summit ultra-sil daypack and this one, the osprey is more comfortable. I didn't like how the sea to summit's straps bunched up and would dig into the front of my shoulders. Plus the pull straps were awkward at times and would get stuck. For I think only grams heavier, this one has far superior shoulder straps with a very light padding plus it has a pocket on the inside top and an outside pocket for your bottle or something. Don't wast your time with the sea to summit buy this one you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: RGC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lightweight travel daypack
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this pack. Bought this to use as a diaper/snack bag for day trips while traveling and it’s prefect. So compact and lightweight that it fits anywhere, and it’s comfortable to wear even when stuffed full (just mind how you place things inside since the back panel is obviously not padded). My husband liked this so much that he carried it happily while we were out and ordered a second one for himself. I have narrow shoulders and didn’t find that I needed a sternum strap for casual outings, but other reviewers have suggested cheap and easy solutions to that problem. Bright green color made it easy to spot in a full suitcase or loose in the car.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Very small, but sturdy enough to get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this bag to bring food home from jobs I do where there's lots of leftover food (catering) and I've used it a few times now. Food isn't light by nature, but I loaded about 10# or so of stuff, including drinks, into the bag and it handled it without easily. I'm very happy with the purchase. I dunno about how water resistant it is, though; no chance to test it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Kang

customer_reviews.title: perfect for travels
customer_reviews.text: This looked so small when I opened the package. When you start to stuff things in, it looks more voluminous. I liked the small pocket on the top and side of the bag. It felt flimsy at first because of the thin/see through fabric but I realize that's just lightweight construction and it has held up very well. The color is bright, but not ugly, orange and you can easily spot it in a room. I brought it on my hike and was told I look like some kind of Dora the Explorer lol.
customer_reviews.author: STARVINGSTUDENT

customer_reviews.title: Packs so small!
customer_reviews.text: This thing packs into such a small space! I purchased many of the other travel back packs on this site and none of them packed as small as this one. I am a little worried that the material is a little thin and fragile. So I would be extra careful not to pack anything that is sharp or even the least bit pointy. There also isn't a ton of padding, really there is none, so don't plan on this being your primary pack. More for like taking along on a short jaunt so you can stuff your souvenirs and jacket if it gets hot.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a great day bag for anyone just needing to get stuff from point A to point B. It has only rained once while I was using this bag so I can not speak to water resistance, but it did ok for me that one day. I use it riding my bike and I have stuffed it full of gear and it feels light as a feather. I forgot several times I had it on. Almost perfect? I would leave this bag as it is and make a similar bag with an interior pocket.
customer_reviews.author: k gannon

customer_reviews.title: I just love this little pack
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time, it is not for carrying heavy items, but it can hold an amazing amount of items. Folds us into a pocket size pouch, great for traveling, add to suitcase and you have a bag to carry all the essentials. The water bottle pocket works far better than more expensive bags I own. The small pocket holds all the keys and phone. This is a feather weight bag that is really comfortable. Would purchase again if lost.
customer_reviews.author: D Scott Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Different from other Osprey bags
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Ultralight. I might use it as my only backpack in my month or two long trips. I get the feeling that the material is somewhat flimsy (perhaps mistaken here) but other bags costing around 12 dollars or so made of parachute material seem more sturdy, and second the material is not fully opaque which makes it easier for the potential thieves. I plan to use cubes that will eliminate that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Vegan

customer_reviews.title: Small and light
customer_reviews.text: The picture makes it look bigger than it is. I won't be able to try actually using it for another 11 days, but it's a lot smaller than the picture makes it look. However, to compact down the the very small size that it can, I guess I should not be surprised. It will be interesting to see if it is robust when I put stuff in it and carry it around Egypt. It's just a daypack, and I wouldn't use it for anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Great foldable backpack, thin material but good quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had a few foldable backpacks by now and I have to say I really enjoy this osprey bag. While the material is thin, this allows the bag to pack down much smaller than comparable backpacks. I love having it in my purse while traveling for that ocasional grocery store trip or 'I'm sick of holding my jacket' moment. I have not worn it all day so I can't speak to the comfort for that much use but it is great for the short term.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Not as described on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Not as described on Amazon. There is no separate stuff sack. I was told you need to use the top pocket, and turn it inside out. However, doing this also turns the zipper inside out, which makes it difficult to close. Also, the “stuffed” size is very misleading. Mine turned out to be more twice the size. I returned this in favor of an Eagle Creek, which was exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ram

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! I put it to the test when I took it to Costa Rica. It is definitely water resistance- while traveling we were always in the rain/mist and all my belonging stayed dried It can handle being stuffed with a ton of stuff. I filled the bag to the max in my way back home and nothing ripped or made the seams tear. I definitely recommend this bag especially for people who will use it for hikes/traveling. And it’s very easy to put back into the small pocket
customer_reviews.author: Gianna

customer_reviews.title: Impressive bag
customer_reviews.text: We already have the eddy bauer 20L versions and used them a lot while travelling. However this is just a bit smaller (believe 18L instead of 20lL but boy while packed this bag is so small, making it very practical for almost anything. Literally it fits in a jacket pocket. The material also seems to be very resistant. Did not test it out for water resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Tesla

customer_reviews.title: I like everything about this bag!
customer_reviews.text: The best I like about it is the size, the little pocket on the top and the quality of straps! Initially I purchased the Sea to Summit Ultra-Sil Travel Day Pack, which wins for size, however its straps are not good at all. Returned it and got the Osprey. Made a great choice! Perfect for a city backpack (For hiking I still use my Camelbak MULE Hydration Pack). Great to hang on your Osprey 40L backpack. No regrets about buying this bag for $27 (got it on sale)!
customer_reviews.author: Yanina M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for an extra bag when traveling
customer_reviews.text: I traveled with this recently. It is comfortable for all day wear and packs down to the size of a small hamburger bun. The water bottle pocket works well. You can fit a ton in the bag and even stuffed it is comfortable. I wish it had a chest strap.
customer_reviews.author: Jeramyn Feucht

customer_reviews.title: I use this daily now
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my personal item for a flight. This plus the osprey duffle make for the best carry on combo. Doesn’t dig into my shoulders. It’s made incredibly well. The zipper pulls are really well thought out, and the stash pocket is a great place to keep documents handy. The side pocket is nice for water bottles. Most other stuff pack backpacks don’t have nearly as many well thought out features. 100% recommend this to anyone who travels light.
customer_reviews.author: Hfdubs

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: This little bag has been all around the world. I use it when traveling and also at home. It is very light weight yet tough. When hiking I can put my camera in it if it starts to rain and it has always come out dry. Really love this backpack. I have been using it for almost two years and it still looks brand new. We just purchased another for my husband, he had backpack envy. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: E Gray

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate, must-have travel item.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome lightweight but high capacity bag that is now a travel staple! This bag packs down to nothing (with some technique and a fair amount of elbow grease) into just larger than a tennis ball, but opens into a full pack that can carry everything you need. I travel several times a monthly domestically and internationally. My fiance and i took this on a trip to Bali and Taiwan recently, and whether it was holding four or five bottles of water, rain gear, sunscreen, valuables, or anything we picked up along the way, this bag handled everything we threw at it comfortably. The construction is super solid too, and I never feared it ripping or not repelling the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt G.

customer_reviews.title: Grey is green
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence between this one and a 4Monster Hiking Daypack. The last one seemed to be better sized for my frame (I'm 5,4", 127lb), but it wasn't easy to fit a lemet inside and the straps seemed to be a little scratchy. In Osprey I could comfortably fit a helmet/protective pads for inline skating or a pair of shoes and a water bottle when skating. If needed maybe I could fit a lightweight sweater as well.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight pack
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my son to use at camp and when biking. I loved it and kept borrowing it so I bought one of my own. It is very lightweight and durable. We haven't dragged them across concrete, but many day hikes and bike rides without signs of wear. I like that it has wide (relative to the size of the pack) shoulder straps - it has been comfortable stuffed with water bottles and jackets. I can stuff it in the small storage pocket for packing. I haven't needed to test it in the rain so far (lucky weather!). No dings from me on this pack!
customer_reviews.author: MNMom18

customer_reviews.title: Great for short hikes and travel
customer_reviews.text: Day pack for short hikes, the beach, pretty much anywhere where you just want to carry the basics, two suggestions would be to add another side water pocket and maybe a daisy chain for lashing small items! Otherwise perfect for a grab ago pack!
customer_reviews.author: jvmbike

customer_reviews.title: Abysmal product!
customer_reviews.text: The material itself was flimsy and already getting loose from stitching. the heaviest item put in bag was an 18oz water bottle and bag was breaking. Not worth the cheap price, I prefer the Northface lightweight bag, superior quality!
customer_reviews.author: E.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing how small it packs down to
customer_reviews.text: What's amazing about this pack is that it's got padded shoulder straps and it packs down to such a small size. The only reason I am giving this 4 stars is, and maybe I am asking for too much, I wish there was at least some form/light padding at the back. It has to be filled up to almost full to get some form, if not it just hangs like a bag.
customer_reviews.author: Harsha J

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack. It is very lightweight and stuffs down ...
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack. It is very lightweight and stuffs down to a ridiculously small size. The straps are reasonably comfortable for a bare essentials pack. I like the simple design. One big pocket for everything you want to carry, and a nice small pocket up top for little items that won't get lost. This pack could be sized even smaller, as if you filled it to capacity, the straps would not feel so comfortable carting that much weight around.
customer_reviews.author: JTree

customer_reviews.title: great portable backpack
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I just used it once for a 6 mile hike and it felt secure even though I jogged for one mile of the trip. I really like how the bag doesn't swing as much when I ran which shows how tight fitting the bag was to my back. One thing that did throw me off on the bag was the color. I got the the shadow grey color but it seems more of an olive green. Either way, its a good product and I cant wait to use it for my Europe trip if COVID doesn't interfere with my plans.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Larios

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: Material is thinner than advertised, no instructions included on how to fold it into itself as advertised. Bag offers no padded protection neither on the straps nor on the bag itself. This makes it impractical for carrying any items like a camera, laptop or any other electronic item that needs protection.
customer_reviews.author: MickeyFanTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lightweight backpack
customer_reviews.text: Perfect backpack if you're looking for something lightweight and packable. It does not have as much support as other backpacks, but that is by design. We use this for daytrips and easy hikes, and it's even water resistant for the days where there is a small drizzle. It's great that it does not add much weight and we can stow it away very easily. It's also easily washable!
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: All around this is a great packable pack. I would buy it again, but you really have to modify it. The straps are way too slippery and constantly slide off my shoulders when hanging it over only one arm. I had to modify the straps to reduce the friction (double-sided permanent hem tape and tennis racket handle wrap).
customer_reviews.author: J de North

customer_reviews.title: Small. How small? Incredibly small.
customer_reviews.text: This daypack is incredibly compressible. I’m amazed at how tiny it gets, approximately a large fist when packed down, packs down easily as well, air doesn’t get trapped but breathes through the fabric if there is a bubble. My only gripe is the “shadow grey” is a complete olive color which is still beautiful but not grey at all. Feels well constructed despite being very light. I anticipate this lasting a long time just like my other osprey bags.
customer_reviews.author: william gamez

customer_reviews.title: Was exactly what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: I was taking a flight overseas with a very low luggage capacity, and I knew I would be doing day trips when I wouldn't want to carry my main backpack, but I barely had room to pack a smaller bag for those day trips. This UL stuff pack was the smallest, lightest, and most packable option I found online, so I ordered it. It delivered early. It was exactly what I was looking for. It performed well on my backpacking trip, and after a month's use, it's proved to be durable. It was certainly worth what I paid for it, and if I needed another one for some reason, I would certainly buy this brand and model again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get way more for your buck. Great pack!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pack! It's perfect for traveling if you want to use it as a carry on or put it in your luggage for when you arrive at your destination. It packs smaller than a wallet. Has a side pocket for a nalgene, a smaller top outside zip pocket with a clip for keys and the cargo area that zips wide open for easy access.
customer_reviews.author: KAM2

customer_reviews.title: Ordered Shadow Grey & Received Green
customer_reviews.text: Received green, but the tag said it was shadow grey. Returned and now waiting for true shadow grey bag. Expected great quality from Osprey. Using for day bag while traveling across Europe. Great for packing into main backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Prime007

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and Light
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pack to take on a trip to Havasupai Falls to use as a 'hiking in camp' day pack. It worked perfectly for that purpose and is super small and lightweight. My husband also has one and he takes it when he travels abroad. I have a friend who also purchased one and WE ALL love our Osprey Ultralite packs.
customer_reviews.author: DK136

customer_reviews.title: Smallest compacting high quality backpack I have ever seen!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I am extremely happy with the material quality of this super lightweight stuff pack!! Easy to pack down into the stuff bag that is attached inside the top pocket; it took maybe 30 seconds to fold up and stuff into the little pocket. My wallet is bigger than this PACKED backpack! It is also very nicely sized when opened up with a large main opening, a good sized second top opening that also hides the stuff pocket. And it has a nice water bottle pocket!! The straps are extremely light but they still do have some support foam in them. Really a great all round ultra light weight stuff pack!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use for day hikes during backpacking trips so I wouldn't have to take my backpacking pack just to carry water, snacks, and an extra layer. While it's not as light as the Sea to Summit pack, it is lighter than the CAMP pack. I picked this because I liked having the side and top pockets for organization. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: A person

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for all-around use!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag to have on hand. I took this to the rifle range a few times and used it to collect my brass and used it as a dump pouch for collecting up my loose mags. I had also taken this (stowed away in my cargo pocket) to the Eagles parade in Philly and was able to police my own trash and carry around my water bottles and even my iPhone charger. Great product. It certainly has real world applications.
customer_reviews.author: USMC 0317

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is exactly what I was looking for! My first use was to a concert where I had to stand in line for a bit to get in. I packed snacks, water, my personal items (wallet, keys, sunglasses, etc...). It still felt super lightweight and the straps were very comfortable. I would also like to add that the concert was only letting small size backpacks inside and this pack qualified as a small bag to be allowed inside. One of the best Amazon purchases I’ve made.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This day pack is PERFECT. The only thing I wish it had was a hook and hole for a camelbak. Seriously though, we hiked miles with all our food and water using this day pack. We tested its limits with weight and it passed! If you’re on the edge about buying it, just buy it. It’s expensive but it’s worth it. It is so tiny and light weight and carries a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Martin Lennon

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight day pack
customer_reviews.text: stuffs easily into its sack, lightweight and durable. only complaints are ones that go with the "stuffable" territory: reduced comfort due to no frame (obviously) and no sternum strap which isn't an issue if I'm tooling around, and if I am more active its pretty easy to solve.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Jeffries

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to stuff in my Osprey Porter 30 so I can have a bag to take exploring. This is light weight and it packs down to the size of a baseball so it doesn't take up too much of my precious space. I'm 5'10" about 255 lbs and I would not recommend this for larger individuals as the straps are kind of short and it may be difficult to get this on and off of your back.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny O

customer_reviews.title: I may need a second one to keep in the car
customer_reviews.text: i travel a lot. Nothing is worse than toting around purchased items in a bag from the store...it rips, gets wet, and started to get cumbersome. This solves that. This became our go-to bag for day trips in Ireland as it kept things quite dry. Additionally, it was easy to put our fragile items in it for the flight home. Probably will get a second one to keep in the car as it's something I'd want to have with me. And it will fit in your pocket!
customer_reviews.author: azroadie

customer_reviews.title: Great Daypack with 1 Thing Missing
customer_reviews.text: Love this daypack! Lightweight, foldable, durable, multiple pockets on top - the only thing missing? An outer pocket on the RIGHT hand side. Since the only pocket is on the left hand side - I have to wear the pack only on my left shoulder in order to access it (which I frequently do for my phone, water, etc). Osprey - Right Handed people are people too! lol Please edit this pack to include outer pockets on BOTH sides. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: mslmiller624

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, but watch your water bottle
customer_reviews.text: This is a really comfortable little ultalight pack. I take it to the beach. My only criticism is that a 16 oz water bottle, when full, falls out of the pocket just about every single time I take the pack on and off. I'll probably remedy this by sewing a little elastic band about 2 in. above the pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Huebert

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight pack that is great for cycling
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight pack that is great for cycling. This pack stuffs down to about the size of a fist and can fit in my bike bag for when I may need a backpack on my trip. The material is very lightweight and pretty waterproof. I have been caught out in the rain with my phone in the top pocket and it has stayed pretty dry. It also dries very fast if it does get wet. There is a side pocket that you can stick a waterbottle in and it has a top pocket with a key clip so you don't have to dig around the whole bag for your keys.
customer_reviews.author: hikercamperdiver

customer_reviews.title: Best compression day pack for travel
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. First and most important, this pack folds into its own little pocket about the size of my fist, so it takes up very little space in my luggage when traveling. The fabric seems thin but through many trips it has proven to be very durable. Also, i didnt exactly get this for its waterproofing abilities, but i took it on a trip through El Yunque rain forest in Puerto Rico and was hiking in puring rain and everything in the pack stayed dry (i had electronics in ziplocs for good practice) and i was quite pleased. This pack is excellent for the modern day traveler.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great for kiddos and sand.
customer_reviews.text: Love Osprey bags. Saw this on sale and grabbed it. On arrival, I was disappointed, it was much smaller then I expected. But, my 3 yr old, loved it. Its a little big on him but in a few years it’ll be perfect. Great for beach/sand, he carries all his buckets and toys now, lightened my load for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Mike F

customer_reviews.title: Superlight and super tough
customer_reviews.text: This backpack has been a life saver for our trip in Asia. We initially thought it was too flimsy, as it is definitely very light, and does pack in a 10cm x 10cm x 3cm small pouch. Once traveling one of our main backpacks, a 30lt Patagonia bag, got wet, and we needed a replacement. This osprey bag held it’s own and then some. Really pleased and will likely but another
customer_reviews.author: Alessandro Quattrochi

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight pack
customer_reviews.text: Never used such a lightweight pack before. Was nicely surprised. Packed into it's own "on-board" pocket - nice feature. Great for wandering the coastal trails. Not sure about it's water resistance, though. Water bottle pocket could be more secure, but really, no issue. Nevertheless, it arrived on time and as expected. Would purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hold everything you need for day trips
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last Oct right before our trip to Mexico. I used it everyday to carry water bottles ( it has a side pouch) and my camera ( I have an older 35 mmm plus long range lense) In addition we sometimes put food in there and other items that we wanted to take along. its water resistant as one day we got caught in the rain and had to walk about 2 miles with it and no umbrella but my items stayed dry. It was well worth the purchase as I thought it was a little pricey at first.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Vincgom

customer_reviews.title: Works fine...
customer_reviews.text: Recently used this for a few day hikes during a long 4th of July weekend in the Sierra Nevada mountains. Met every expectation. Large enough for a couple of light jackets, lunch, water/pump, and other essentials when bagging peaks and exploring high tarns. Recommenced!
customer_reviews.author: wpb

customer_reviews.title: Nice extra compartments
customer_reviews.text: Love that this is durable, water resistant and has a nice color. Considering it is Osprey it is at a decent price point and includes a little top zipper compartment and a generous water bottle mesh holder. The shoulder straps are slightly padded which is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: WhatsInAName?

customer_reviews.title: Light and awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love how small this packs away. Bought to include in my travel backpack for a lighter day bag. I am surprised how well it is built and yet compresses to so small a package. Have shown this to several people, and there are always oohs and ahhss. Thank you for including an interior pocket for small stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Everett O'Keefe

customer_reviews.title: Great little day backpack when you need it
customer_reviews.text: Easy and convenient to store. No frills backpack with a few loops to things on. Shoulder straps are just the same fabric as the bag itself. Useful to pack along with a larger hiking/camping backpack when you need to the extra storage but don't want to have to empty the hiking backpack and just need a small bag temporarily.
customer_reviews.author: trew22

customer_reviews.title: Would have liked more water repellency
customer_reviews.text: The bag doesn’t really fold into the pocket as easily as I had hoped and 18L seems to be not that big as I had imagined because of the way it is stitched together. It also didn’t really say it was 18L in the description.
customer_reviews.author: SK Lee

customer_reviews.title: Took This Bag To Las Vegas
customer_reviews.text: I recently went to a trip to Las Vegas and wanted to carry something with me that would allow me to carry extra clothing or snacks while walking down the strip and this bag was perfect! I kept it squared away in my cargo pocket and when the time came all I had to do was take it out of its own bag and fill it with stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Errin LTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this before. I was looking for a bag to put in my backpack for side trips. Yet, I've come to depend on this for lots of other short distance trips where all I need is a man purse. This rocks without jeopardizing my cis-gender status. I've used it for lots of day trips where before I used bigger and heavier packs.
customer_reviews.author: IL_Lax_Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Impressed it worked so well.
customer_reviews.text: We used this small pack pack in place of our regular larger more structured backpack on a recent 2 week trip. The backpack held up well, was comfortable and held its shape well. I used it everyday to hold multiple small items. I thought it did a good job and packed up small to fit in my suitcase. The side pocket to hold a water bottle worked well as did the small zipper compartment. I was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality brand.
customer_reviews.text: I took a flyer on this pack. Im not disappointed, just wish it was a little easier to pack into a little carrying bag like the pic...I cant figure that out. Oh well it stores easily and seems sturdy enough too.
customer_reviews.author: Fatmel

customer_reviews.title: This pack was very good. I was traveling in Europe for 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This pack was very good. I was traveling in Europe for 2 weeks. Used it everyday for day tripping. Served the purpose, well constructed. Great zippers. Extra zippered pocket at top was great for easy retrieval of small items. One more outer zipper pocket/pouch would be great to separate additional items needing quick access to. Water bottle pocket is not so great. It was easy to reach to the water bottle without removing pack but bottles fell out easily when removing pack. Especially larger 1 liter bottles. Pack stuffs down really small for packing. If I could not find another pack like this wit hthe additional pocket and better water bottle holder I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: joe alati

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of the weight distribution
customer_reviews.text: For an osprey backpack it feels cheap and takes quite a bit of work to stuff it into its small compartment for travel. The shoulder straps dig into me when I use it and so I've avoided it when I can on my trip.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Schillinger

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, gorgeous colour, quality product and value.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little pack for the price. It fold up to nothing, but can fit a lot of stuff. It is nice to have a pocket for a water bottle but if you bend over, your bottle is going flying. I could do without the key ring for a compression strap to hold down the bottle. Great to attach to my pack to keep trash or extra snacks. So lightweight!!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Neuhauser

customer_reviews.title: great pack.
customer_reviews.text: I love this pack. Its perfect to carry light things especially when you know your pack will get dirty. Im hesitant to wash my packs with hard backs but i already have rinsed this off a few times after it has gotten dirty. Its perfect when you dont need to worry about carrying a water bladder. It also folds up very small and is very light.
customer_reviews.author: jessica g

customer_reviews.title: the bag I've always been looking for
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag--its lightweight --can stuff into a small suitcase and come out at the ready. Its light weight and colorful. Not sure about water resistance--would assume okay for sprinkles but not a downpour
customer_reviews.author: MORY

customer_reviews.title: Great pack.
customer_reviews.text: Best packable backpack! I wanted to pack light for a trip to Indonesia where I would be flying on budget airlines that force you to check any and all bags. The less you carry, the less likely you're made to check bags. I would stuff this into my backpack easily, and then use it in between flights for any and all excursions. It held two 40 oz hydroflasks, a camera and an underwater housing very easily. Highly recommended! Felt durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ali A

customer_reviews.title: light use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight and easy to pack backpack, but unfortunately does not stand up to even moderate years. I traveled with the PAC in an urban setting. By the end of the week, there are several small rips and tears. The ripstop material did prevent the tears from spreading, but overall the quality of the bag is lacking. It is vulnerable to even routine travel experiences in an urban setting. Too bad, because it is otherwise quite comfortable and ergonomic. I would recommend this bag for only light use.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Not a day pack
customer_reviews.text: I learned the hard way the difference between a "stuff sack" and a "day pack" when I oredered this bag. This bag is very small. More of a day out in the farmers market or sight seeing kind of bag than a real day pack. If you want a small bag you can fold up and put in your purse order this bag ... otherwise this is not what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Dana S. Stinson

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, but in my opinion, there's not enough support.
customer_reviews.text: I brought this on a backpacking trip. I ended up leaving it at our camp and using my backpacking backpack as my daypack. It was too uncomfortable with 1l of water, a sat phone, first aid kit, layer, and lunch.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight day pack for side trips
customer_reviews.text: I use this while backpacking at Philmont. We'd leave our main packs at camp an take a daypack to summit Baldy. It was the perfect size and a tiny weight penalty of 3 oz. great for some spare clothing, water, and a few snacks.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Good extra bag
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can pack it away and it's very small. I like to take it on trips when I may need another bag. I've used it for a bike marathon, hiking, an anime convention, traveling, and camping. It's nice to throw little trinkets in or a water bottle and a jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Hnou

customer_reviews.title: Forget this review and just buy the pack!!!
customer_reviews.text: This pack is amazing. Brought it around as my gf and I explored on our backpacking trip throughout europe and this thing was a life saver. Packs down so small you could put it in your pocket, but was big enough to hold a patagonia softshell fleece, a'rctryex rain jacket, 2 pairs of sunglasses, a go pro, a panasonic G7 camera, amazon kindle w/case, table stand, passport, eyemask, ear plugs, and a few other smaller items. If you're backpacking, this is a no brainer and a must have! Just buy one right now. Osprey quality is the best I've found.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Needs more compartments
customer_reviews.text: If you want light weight this is it, but it’s not very functional. It has one big storage space but not much else. I ended up buying a cheaper backpack that had many more compartments but was almost as light.
customer_reviews.author: Opie1

customer_reviews.title: Functional and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely simple, lightweight, but practical. Osprey quality. Because of its simplicity, the pack has no structure. Do recommend, if you’re looking for a minimalist daypack.
customer_reviews.author: RangeRat

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight travel pack worked great on our vacation. It held all of our day-trip items, and was super light weight and easy to carry. I'm very happy with this little pack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I have some $10 travel pocket pouch packs I’ve used for years that are better made with more compartments and more comfortable straps. Not their usual impressive product.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It’s a little snug in its travel bag. Have packed it down about 4 times. No rips or tears from using it or stuffing it. Recommend for putting in your car for that unexpected hike.
customer_reviews.author: michelle nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Nice purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before my trip to Costa Rica. This is a worthy, good quality product. Flexible on the size, what I love most is the top pocket and side bottle pocket. I wasn't thinking I could have used it that frequently but it's perfect for my use.
customer_reviews.author: wang dong

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lightweight daypack
customer_reviews.text: My go to daypack when traveling or hiking. 1 large and 2 small storage areas plus a mesh pocket for a water bottle. Folds down into a fist sized self storing ball.
customer_reviews.author: ATL Gadgets

customer_reviews.title: Small enough to not overpack; large enough for essentials
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this for a recent trip to Iceland. It was large enough to carry a water bottle and any other "essentials" he required [few]. Perfect for him.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Great for casual, everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: NOT waterproof, barely water resistant... Don't buy this thinking it's a great pack for outdoor adventures. However it is excellent for a personal bag when flying and great for carrying a few things on a casual, good weather hike or a run. I use it a LOT. As mentioned in other reviews, if used for running it might be best to also pick up a chest strap to keep the pack in place.
customer_reviews.author: B Bachman

customer_reviews.title: Great spare travel pack
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife for a once-in-a-lifetime trip to Scotland. Rolls up into an amazingly compact package and fits in a corner of the suitcase, but holds a rain jacket and other stuff (including a water bottle) for a day of sightseeing. Weighs nothing and is comfortable to wear. She loved it and carried it constantly for 3 weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Albert

customer_reviews.title: As advertised, but not what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This bag is packable, light weight, and seemed to be water resistant. The material, however, is extremely thin and seemed kind of flimsy. It does what it says, but wasn’t what I was looking for. I returned this item and bought a proper day pack instead.
customer_reviews.author: User_Level_Advanced

product_meta.title: Osprey Ultralight Stuff Pack
product_meta.description: While traveling or backpacking there is often a need for a small day pack to carry just the essentials for a day trip and then disappear when not in use. The Osprey Ultralight Stuff Pack does just that with deluxe features not found most crushable daypacks.
feature_bullets: Pack stuffs into its own ultra-compact, built-in storage pocket
Stretch mesh side gear or water bottle pocket
Top zippered pocket for easy access to essential gear

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
